column4: ....the Ubuntu Guide does not talk about mounting another Harddrive
how can I do it? it is a NTFS drive
look beyond the ubuntuguide
mounting hard drives of any flavors is a common linux operation
ask uncle google, he will help you (or go to www.tldp.org and wallow in the knowledge there)
it is possible, to mount ntfs. go 2 www.tldp.org
my advice would be to mount the NTFS read-only, back up your stuff, and then reformat it to a linux filesystem
and put all your stuff back
The Linux Documentation Project (www.tldp.org) has tons of info on mounting every possible device that can be stuck into a machine
it doesnt have to come from ubuntuguide
mornin
<mutter>join the club</mutter>
our a/c went out, so no sleep til monday
point to point protocol daemon
your 'buntu box is positively SWARMING with daemons right at this very instant!
dunno what you've got installed, might be a cupsd, a sshd, dunno
if you have CUPS installed, you have a cups(D)aemon running
the cupsd 'listens' for you to hit <ctrl-p> or whatver it is to print something
if you have dialup, the ppp(d)aemon listens for "pon" (dial up) and "poff" (hang up) and it dials the phone or hangs up
just giving you examples
did i explain your daemons adequately?
the daemons 'listen' for their cue to go to work, yes
yes breezy is the next level
